attributes.action: Government Pay Reform: People instead pay their taxes to the party they support.
attributes.additional_details:
This system can be implimented according to each last general election vote % stats equalised to total spending using real pokerchips;

Conservative then has 50.8% of chips to total spending %
Labour has 37.5%
SNP has 8.6%
etc (fill)

The parties that agree on a policy (ie; to pay schools) each chip in to an equal distrubution. To such (ie) 1 man has £2, another has £1, a bag of sweets costs £1.50. therefore the 1st man pay's £1, the other 50p.

After that each party chips to their own policies.
attributes.background: No one wants to pay taxes to parties they don't support, no one also wants for there to be no taxes paid also, this meets in the middle. The party trusted recieves their income to help the community according to their policies they can afford and amend to. Everyone's "happier" & there's competition.
